channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scaling to 10 Rentals in 2 Years & $6K/Month Cash Flow with Low Money Down
item.description: What’s stopping you from investing in real estate? Money? What if there was a profitable rental you could buy with just $500 down? Well, today’s guest has found the perfect […]

item.title: Paymob, started by three college friends, lands another $22 million and is profitable in Egypt
item.description: Paymob has evolved into an omnichannel gateway offering over 50 methods for offline and online payments to more than 350,000+ merchants. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: She Ate a Poppy Seed Salad Just Before Giving Birth. Then They Took Her Baby Away.
item.description: Hospitals use drug tests that return false positives from poppy seed bagels, decongestants and Zantac. Yet newborns are being taken from parents based on the results.

item.title: How to Scale Your Real Estate Portfolio So You Build Wealth, NOT Burn Out
item.description: Scale smarter with Kathy and Rich’s new book, Scaling Smart! Own real estate? Feeling burnt out? Then you need to listen to this. You’ve wondered how to scale your real […]

item.title: InMobi secures $100 million for AI acquisitions ahead of IPO
item.description: Adtech startup InMobi has raised $100 million in debt financing as the profitable Indian firm looks to “significantly deepen” its artificial intelligence initiatives and fund potential AI acquisitions ahead of a planned IPO next year. Mars Growth Capital, a joint venture between MUFG and Liquidity Group, has financed the funding, InMobi said Wednesday. The investment […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Seemingly Endless Cycle of Reforms in Juvenile Justice
item.description: As Ohio considers closing youth detention facilities, recent efforts in other states have hit roadblocks.

item.title: Police Officer Surpasses $10K/Month FI Goal w/Out-of-State Sober Living Investments
item.description: Achieving your FI number in just four years? If you want to do it too, you must try something different. This couple found a niche within a niche, allowing them […]

item.title: Sergey Brin says he’s working on AI at Google ‘pretty much every day’
item.description: Google co-founder and ex-Alphabet president Sergey Brin said he’s back working at Google “pretty much every day” because he hasn’t seen anything as exciting as the recent progress in AI — and doesn’t want to miss out. Brin revealed the tidbit in an interview during the All-In Summit in L.A. this week. Last year, several […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: You’re About to Deliver Your Baby. This Faulty Drug Test Could Take Your Newborn Away.
item.description: Listen to our investigation into how hospitals use unreliable test results to report parents to child welfare agencies.

item.title: A 5-Year Plan for Financial Freedom With Real Estate (That Anyone Can Replicate)
item.description: There's no "fast track" to financial freedom, but with careful steps and a goal, it's certainly possible to do it in five years.

item.title: Beats makes iPhone 16 cases now
item.description: The $49 cases work with MagSafe and the iPhone’s new Camera Control button. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Serious Case of Prison Visit Blues
item.description: Tariq MaQbool reflects on disruptive COVID-era visitation restrictions that remain in effect at New Jersey State Prison.

item.title: America’s Top Tech Hubs—and the Real Estate Growth It’s Driving
item.description: Redfin once published data that showed for every 1% increase in tech workers in their sample of cities, there was an average 0.49% increase in home prices. Granted, the article […]

item.title: Senate leaders ask FTC to investigate AI content summaries as anti-competitive
item.description: A group of Democratic senators is urging the FTC and Justice Department to investigate whether AI tools that summarize and regurgitate online content like news and recipes may amount to anticompetitive practices. In a letter to the agencies, the senators, led by Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), explained their position that the latest AI features are hitting […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Efforts to Cut Long Prison Sentences Have Stalled
item.description: Crime victim advocates and conservative groups are resisting moves to revisit “truth-in-sentencing” laws.
